org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource

Class NodeSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.NodeSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.objectweb.proactive.Active, org.objectweb.proactive.InitActive, org.objectweb.proactive.RunActive

    public class NodeSource
extends Object
implements org.objectweb.proactive.InitActive, org.objectweb.proactive.RunActive
    Abstract class designed to manage a NodeSource. A NodeSource active object is designed to manage acquisition, monitoring and removing of a set of Node objects in the Resource Manager. Each node source consists of two entities InfrastructureManager and NodeSourcePolicy.
    Each particular InfrastructureManager defines a specific infrastructure and ways to manipulate nodes.
    The node source policy NodeSourcePolicy defines a strategy of nodes acquisition. It can be static acquiring nodes once and forever or dynamic where nodes acquisition takes into account different external factors such as time, scheduling state, etc.

      • getNodeInDeployingOrLostNodes

        public RMDeployingNode getNodeInDeployingOrLostNodes(String nodeUrl)
        Returns the deploying node identified by the specified nodeUrl.
        Parameters:
        nodeUrl - the URL of the deploying node to lookup.
        Returns:
        the deploying node found, or null. Since a node source is an Active Object, the caller will receive a deep copy of the original object.

      • detectedPingedDownNode

        public void detectedPingedDownNode(String nodeName,
                                   String nodeUrl)
        Marks node as down. Remove it from node source node set. It remains in rmcore nodes list until user decides to remove them or node source is shutdown.
        See Also:
        detectedPingedDownNode(String, String)

      • getStub

      • getAdminPermission

        public Permission getAdminPermission()
        Returns the permission which administrator must have. Administrator of the node source can remove it, add nodes to this node source and remove any node.

      • getProviderPermission

        public Permission getProviderPermission()
        Returns the permission required to add/remove nodes to/from the node source. Provider can remove only its one nodes.

      • getRegistrationURL

        the registration url the node spawn by this nodesource must use.
